string.text: Greetings stalker, how can I help you?
I'm Marked One. Colonel Petrenko sent me to see Barkeep and Voronin.
Oh, so you're Marked One. Come on in, I'm sure he is expecting you. Welcome to the new 100 Rads Bar. At least we can play pool here.
Thanks for letting me in.
Any chance of letting me in?
You have no business here stalker - move along.
I'll be back when I do.
You again? I hope you have business here this time...
Nope, but I'll be back.
Take it easy and enjoy yourself, stalker.
Don't mind if I do.
So, what can you tell me?
Glad to see you made it, Marked One. We got word that you managed to take down the Merc helis, good job!
Yeah, it wasn't easy, but I'm here in one piece.

I can see that. Well, I'm busy gauging the damage done to my business. It's a mess for everyone... We lost many good men during the attack. The delicate balance of power has shifted and Freedom is on the rise now, since Duty have been hit so hard - and let me tell you, Duty isn't happy. Why don't you go speak to Voronin in the back room while you're at it? We've got a problem, a big one.
I'll go see him.
Have you spoken to Voronin?
Not yet, I'm on my way.
Good luck out there, Marked One!
Thanks.
My congratulations, Strelok. You disabled all this damned crap which brainwash hundred of our mates through the years. Voronin awaits you. I guess he wants to thank you personally.
Thank you. I'll go and see him.
Hey, mate. You just passing through or have anything to talk about?
Just looking around.

Hey, you've made it! I've heard from Colonel Petrenko that everything is sorted out at the Bar. Well, as good as it can be... Hopefully someday we can rebuild what we once had. The mutants are flooding the place just like how it was before we established the Bar - the Wild Territory has re-emerged. However, we can't dwell on it with the situation at hand. Do you mind hearing me out, Marked One?
Shoot.

As you know, the way to Pripyat and beyond is covered with deadly psy-emissions due to the Brain Scorcher. It has been like that since the Zone existed. Sometimes the strength of them increases or falls at certain intervals, but it's the same pattern. But after all that scavenging in the old laboratories Petrenko has done - way before X18 and others - we've discovered how to shut this system down. We need someone that has proven himself, and you're the finest man I've seen so far for such a mission. There's going to be disagreements among my men, but I want the Scorcher to be deactivated - even if Freedom wants the same thing. That contraption has been the bane of human existence for too long. Go and see Ivancov for more information, I marked his location on your map.
Agreed. If we have a way to stop it, then I'll do everything I can.
Go and see Ivancov, he'll brief you on the situation. He can explain our plan much better than I.
OK, I'm on it.
How did you find this place, stalker? I'm not going to gun you down, but if you don't have a reason to be here, I suggest you move along.
General Voronin sent me here for a debriefing on the Scorcher situation. I'm Marked One.

Oh, my apologies, I didn't know. Well, Marked One, here's the situation: We need to disable the emitters which are causing and broadcasting the massive psy-emissions fields blocking the way to the center. You will need a way to protect you from these emissions. Go and see Professor Sakharov back in Yantar; he can help you out with one of his psy-helmets.
I'll go see him then.

Hold your horses there! Turning off the Brain Scorcher's emitters is not enough. There is a sort of "backup Scorcher" which is under the Lost Factory, within the X16 lab beneath it. Before you shut off the Scorcher, X16 needs to be shut down or else the Radar antennae will still be operational. The scientists will help you out with that as it comes - they are as eager as anyone to shut down the blasted things.
Okay then, I'll keep that in mind.
have you disabled the emitters yet?
Not yet. I'm working on it.
Hey, if it isn't the emitter disabler. Good job stalker, never doubted you for a second!
Yeah thanks, all in a days work.
Thank you Marked One, Duty owes you.
Glad to help, General. However, these tremors are still a thing...

Ah, yes, now that you mention it, the quakes we feel are caused by an old experimental earthquake device - a derelict, but functional weapon of destruction, that could've been used to target specific areas on the globe. It wasn't such a problem, but ever since we've moved here the tremors have risen. Even Freedom has noticed them and are accusing us of instigating all this. For the record, we didn't.
Then we've got to turn it off for everyone's sake. Where is it situated?
It's in a lab under the old water dam. I've sent others to investigate, but they haven't returned.
I'll take care of that too. They're getting worse, and who knows what a strong one will do to this building.
Hurry if you can - these earthquakes are becoming more frequent and irritating!
I'll sort it out. You help your men tend to their wounds.
Marked One, we can't thank you enough. A possible conflict with Freedom has been avoided in our moment of vulnerability. Now we can concentrate on our work without all the interruptions.
It was no problem, General. See you later, I guess.
Not so fast! Someone had left a note for you while you were gone. Seems like he wants to meet you at the old church - it's not far away.
A note? Well, uh, thank you. I'll go and check the church.
You take care out there, Marked One.
I will thanks General.
Strelok, it's nice to see you with such vitality. I believed you had truly passed away, but it seems I was wrong.
Guide - am I right?
Yes, I am Guide, the very same from the legends, more or less - the one who led you to the center months ago. Do you remember me?
Vaguely. That handwriting was familiar. Have you seen Doc? He wanted to get a hold of you too.
Yeah, I'm here because of that... but since we have an extra minute ask me anything, and I will answer with whatever humble insights I have.
That's very handy: I have a lot of questions.
Why did you lead me to the center in the first place?

It was a hunch. At first, I didn't know who you people were... but something in my gut told me you were to be trusted. A seemingly normal guy such as yourself among all these warped realities was an attractive prospect, I must admit. The whole thing kind of reminded me of these other two guys I took out once, a professor and a writer. Call it an act of charity, or perhaps I was getting bored that day - you figure it out and choose which suits your ego.
I see.
How did you get us past the Brain Scorcher back then?

Call it intuition if you must. I'm no man of science or God by any means, but I can read the Zone like an open book. What you might see as boars feasting on a dead stalker, I would see as a clue about the zone around us and an opportunity to learn more. I have a sort of sixth sense that allows me to casually sidestep the inconveniences of the Zone. Knowing how to pass the Scorcher back then was as natural as the act of walking.
Right.
What do you know about the Zone's origins?

Whatever you've come to suspect is a half-truth. Indeed, the Zone was given life by the mistakes of humanity, but it has grown beyond mere human understanding. It has an unripe sentience to it - the embryo of a new realm not bound by cosmic laws. Even if the Zone's core is to be torn to pieces, it won't make it disappear. At best, it'll only stop the growth. Yet somehow, I doubt it would all end there like a fairytale. This only seems like a prologue to something far more sinister.
Interesting theory.
You can ask.
Ask freely.
Any questions left?
So now you are a bit more up to speed.
So what will you do? We're planning on going back to the center. Do you want to help or not?
Yes, I will guide you. We can't go now through Pripyat's outskirts , need to go through undergrounds. Talk to me when you're ready to go.
I'm ready to go now.
Okay, give me a little more time to prepare.
Let me get there alone, meet you there.
Best of luck to you. Oh, and I have something for you - a "Compass". It will bring you good luck.
Thanks, I'll keep it close.
Come when you're ready.
I think I'm ready.
You sure? We still have some time.
Hey Stalker, this is freedom territory and we are closed at this moment. What is your business here?
I have a password.
Let me in.
You are from... DUTY?! Get the hell out of here!
You think I am THAT stupid and forgot your face already?! Get lost, you Duty bastard!
Hmm, really? That's interesting, what is it?
Torchok.
How did you... okay, never mind. I guess you are a friend of ours. You may pass, just don't act like an ass in there and drink moderately!
Hey, you... did you see the flashcard on the barman's table? Empty your pockets!
Get lost!
Alright, relax. Take your thing.
Really? You thought you could get out of here without any trouble and sell it? Idiot, if I see you here ever again you are dead! Understand?!
Yes, I am going right now.
It was not me, it was...
Who?
Probably this one! Near the table!
We know you got some important info from Freedom. Can you be so kind and give it to us? We can of course put a bullet in your head too if you want...
Yeah, sure, I don't want any trouble. Take it.
Good decision, now you can walk away from here alive.
Get lost, punk!
I will wait for you here while you finish your business there.
All done, let's go.
Ok, I'll be back soon hopefully.
Sergeant, we detected a group of mercenaries moving towards your position... I guess we were too late. I'll wait for the report.
Hi stalker, what can we do for you?
I was passing by and thought I would introduce myself
A wise move. My guys don't like unfamiliar faces walking around here, they get a bit twitchy. So what's your name stalker?
I am Strelok.
Strelok, wow in the flesh. You're a very good person to know, so I hear.
Really? Well if you say so...

Ah come on, don't be modest man! I heard you're a man who gets the job done. I am Lukash by the way, leader of Freedom in these parts and all other parts he he. Maybe one day you could join us in our quest for freedom.
Maybe, but I have many things to do first.
Ok, well we always need things done around here, so don't be a stranger.
Ok, sure.
So, about that offer.
You ready for a big task?
Sure, lay it on me.
Not yet, give me some time.

There is a place called the Construction Site, not too far away; I'm sure you're familiar with it. The Merc trader there has a key that he stole from me. It opens a door on Radar where I have an important piece of machinery kept hidden. He knows what I am hiding, but does not know where it is.
So I just waltz in there and take it?
Haha, funny guy! No, first you will need to get the password to enter the Merc camp. Go see the stalker trader nearby: he knows it and with some persuading may just give it to you.
Actually, I have the password already.
Great! You're half way there.
Ok, so I have the password. All I need to do is, get past the guards and then just take the key, right?
Ok, so I'll need to get the password, get past the guards and then just take the key, right?

Go at night, they are all drunkards at the bar and sleep very heavily, but be careful. Usually he leaves the key just lying around, bragging to everyone how he holds the key to the future, then gets drunk and leaves it there for the picking. Of course neither I nor my men can get anywhere near there.
Then I take the key to Radar and retrieve your machine?
Exactly, you catch on fast. Do this for us and the guys will look upon you very favorably, and I will give you a little something in appreciation.
Ok, mark the areas on my PDA and I'll get going.
About the task.
You found out the password yet?
Yes, got it.
Not yet, still need to get it.
Ok now go get that key.
Ok, I'm on it.
You found the key yet?
Yes got it.
Not yet, but I will soon.
Great now go get me that machine.
Ok, I'll bring it soon.
So, do you have the machine yet?
Sure, here it is. Do you mind telling what it actually is?
Not yet, sorry.

Good job! I knew you were a "go to" guy and you delivered. Since you did me a huge favor, I'll let you in on the secret. This machine can create anomalies. Those dangerous, freaks of nature. Can you imagine if it got into the wrong hands? One of the Eggheads was messing around one day and created it quite by mistake. When the military heard about it, they hired the mercenaries to get it for them. I just couldn't imagine a weapon of this magnitude getting into military hands, that is why we intervened and stole the machine. We are all about freedom, and that very freedom which we strive to attain would be history should the military start messing around with this baby.
Wow, Ok, well I'm glad I helped you then. Sounds like it was a worthy cause.
Worthy indeed. Now about that little something I promised you. Here it is, compliments of the boys to you, and like I said before, don't be a stranger.
thanks, I really do appreciate it. Perhaps we will meet again.
So, I'm back after my quest.
Hey, so are you ready to join Freedom yet?
Yes, I'm ready.
Not yet, maybe later.
Then it is so, take this suit, you are one of us now.
That's it? No fancy ceremony or anything?
No need, you have proved yourself to me, that is enough.
Thank you, I will wear the suit with honor.
Well if it isn't my old mate Marked One.
Good to see you made it out of there.
Yes, and thanks to you I still have my baby.
Don't mention it, stay safe.
Hey, how goes it?
Well I'm alive, but thanks to you I lost my baby and had to buy a shitty AK!
Ok... stay cool man...
Hello. Are you the one repairing and upgrading things?
Yes, I'm the local technician. But you can count on the repairs alone. Only Duty members get the upgrades from me. These are the rules.
Well, thanks for that.
Hi, I need some help with the equipment.
You're not the only one after hustle like that.
So what?

Alright, I'll help. I'll repair your stuff, at least. Well, I can even assume that you are one of us already, and upgrade some of your stuff. We were running for our lives, so I left all the tools there.
I could fetch those tools for you, if you upgrade my stuff afterwards. What do you say?
Yeah, of course, Marked One. You're a true friend to Duty, so I'll treat you like one of us. Well, maybe it'll be more expensive. I just need the tools.
That's a deal, I'll get them.
I'm here about the tools.
What do you got there?
Brought you something, a tools for rough work.
Brought you something, a tools for fine work.
Got you a calibration toolkit.
Splendid! Well, now I need tools for rough work.
Splendid! Well, now I need tools for fine work.
Splendid! Well, now I need calibration toolkit.
Splendid! Well, now I need tools for rough and fine work.
Splendid! Well, now I need tools for rough work and calibrations.
Splendid! Well, now I need tools for fine work and calibrations.
That's all! Now I have a complete set. I can upgrade whatever you want!
Hello. Are you the one repairing stuff around here?
Howdy. I'm also the one upgrading everything.
That means you'll help me?
I would, but I just got here, so I don't have any tools yet. Well, someone like you could help me...
Yeah, I can look around. So that's a deal?
Deal!
I'm here about the tools.
What do you got there?
Brought you something, a tools for rough work.
Brought you something, a tools for fine work.
Got you a calibration toolkit.
That's great! Well, now I need tools for rough work.
That's great! Well, now I need tools for fine work.
That's great! Well, now I need calibration toolkit.
That's great! Well, now I need tools for rough and fine work.
That's great! Well, now I need tools for rough work and calibrations.
That's great! Well, now I need tools for fine work and calibrations.
That's all! My tool set is complete now. Thanks a lot!
